title: Developers, please read this review if you want to improve your game (player of over 5 years)
text:
Subway Surfers is a decent endless runner game with vibrant visuals and addictive gameplay. However, it falls short in certain aspects that could greatly enhance the player experience. Iâ€™ve been playing this game for years, and unfortunately, at a certain point, it gets to be no fun. 

Hover boards, a crucial element in navigating obstacles, lack the option to fully upgrade (upgrades are specific only to the specific board you have and, say you want to use double jump on a board that has no upgrade options, youâ€™re out of luck), limiting player control in a game that has a lot of potential. Additionally, the restriction to selecting only two power-ups at a time feels limiting; expanding to three or four would provide more strategic options. Even then, there is a lack of actually useful power ups for boards- I pretty much exclusively use double jump and super speed (because the game is so slow that itâ€™s almost zero fun to play without a super speed board). 

The game's pay-to-win model becomes apparent in events where acquiring new characters can feel like a costly endeavor. Super mystery boxes, though rare, most often yield very underwhelming rewards, making the pursuit of the jackpot seemingly futile and is something nobody really attempts. National ranking adds a competitive edge but is marred by platform-specific limitations, detracting from its significance- users on iPhone canâ€™t see the scores of android users, so whatâ€™s the point in being #1 nationally if itâ€™s only for iPhone users? Even then, there is no world-wide ranking system which is ironic for a game that does a â€œworld tourâ€ pretty much constantly. 

Furthermore, the ceiling for increasing multipliers through missions feels prematurely capped, discouraging further engagement beyond a certain point. 

Enhancing these aspects would undoubtedly elevate the overall experience, fostering greater player satisfaction and longevity.
